shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 2r-113va) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 2r-87r) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 87v-96v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 96v-101v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 102ra-110ra) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 110ra-113va)
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: The name of the scribe has been erased from the concluding supplication on fol. 113va.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased from the concluding supplication on fol. 113va and replaced with that of Fǝśśǝḥa Ṣǝyon (?), in a secondary hand. In later supplications Gäbrä Mäsqäl is mentioned (e.g., fols. 49r, 55r).

txstates.txstate: The spine cover has been crudely repaired with recent synthetic threads. Some fols. are stained with wax: e.g., fols. 2r-3v, or water: e.g., fols. 2r-5v, 12r-13r, 16r-19r. Holes are burnt on fols. 17 and 19. Some fols. are torn along the inner vertical ruling line: e.g., fols. 11, 23, 34. Holes and tears amended on fols. 1, 10, 47, 49, 70, 88, 97.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays (a mirror might have once been attached to the inner side of the front board). Overback made of reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover has faded. Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown overback (at least one tool was used: triple line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Traces of two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: I(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 1r-9v) – ፪II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – ፫III(8/fols. 18r-26v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – ፭V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – ፲X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – ፲፬XIV(9; s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 106r-114v).

taunit.mr-info: Texts: I-1, 1-2, 1-3: all data are for fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 103r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Careful, in a well- trained hand

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by a fine, rounded and slanted script.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra (name of ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer in Texts I-1 and I-2, name of St. Mary in Text I-4 and I-5); one or two lines of each Ps. in Text I-1; titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; names of the Hebrew letters and their interpretations in Ps. 118; letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስብሕዎ in Ps. 150; letters ባ, ክ and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ in the Canticle 10; a few words and their abbreviation (introducing each strophe) in Text I-4 and I-5; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals. A few lines on the incipit page of all texts and the sections of Text I-4.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-4 ሰ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fols. 103vab, 104vb, 106ra, 109rb) ሰ፡ ለ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fol. 106va) ሰ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fol. 107ra) ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fols. 102ra-109vb) Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 102rb) እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 103ra-104ra) ነዓ፡(ብ) for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 106ra-107ra) ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 108va-109ra) ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fol. 109vab) Text I-5 ወ፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (fols. 111ra-113ra) ወል፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (fol. 110rb) The abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: በእ፡(ን) for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 110vb-112vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The following Pss. are numbered incorrectly: Pss. 46: ፵፭, 48: ፶፰, 49: ፶፱, 86: ፹፭, 92: ፺፩, 93: ፺፪, 110: ፻፳, 111:፻፳፩, 112: ፻፳፪. - Ps. 150 is numbered as ፻፵፲.

additional.cont: Fols. 101v, 114r: Protective prayer.
additional.det: The text begins on fol. 101v and continues on fol. 114r. Some parts of the text are hardly legible because of faded ink.

additional.cont: Fol. 113vb: Miracle of the Archangel Raphael.
additional.det: The text is hardly legible because of faded ink.
The text is hardly legible because of faded ink.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a chain of asterisks between two lines of alternating black and red dots. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: e.g., fols. 13r, 14v, 40r, 67r, 70r, 100v. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 13v, 49v, 88r, 90v, 98v. - Omissions inserted interlineally, in the main hand: e.g., fols. 2r, 57r, 64v, 77rv, 95v, 105ra; in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 32v, 43r. - Corrections written over erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 12v, 79r, 85r, 106va, 113rb. - Instructions concerning the use of some Pss. written in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 8v, 11v, 31r, 57v. - Pen trial: fol. 114r. - Erased (supplication) notes: e.g., fols. 76v, 77rv, 96v. - Short supplications for (ʾabunä) Gäbrä Mäsqäl, in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 49r, 55r. - Short supplications in different hands: e.g, fols. 30r (name erased) and 96v. - Crude drawings (crosses and a human face): fols. 1v, 16v, 114v. - Crude notes in ink, pen and pencil: fols. 1r (hardly legible because of faded ink), 55v, 56r, 73v, 99r, 113v, 114r. - Scribbles, in pencil: e.g., fols. 1v, 17r, 18v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks in the left corner of the upper margin of fols. 10r, 18r, 26r, 34r, 42r, 50r, 58r, 66r, 74r, 82r, 90r, 98r, 106r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in the margin, in pen and pencil: ዘሃሙስ, ዘሐሙስ: fols. 49r, 55r ዘዓርብ: fols. 68r, 76r ዘቀደመ[sic]: fol. 78r. - Red threads inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 17r, 24r, 49r, 55r, 78r.

frames.frame: - Fol. 2r (incipit page of Text I-1): frontispiece elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental frame: wide horizontal band with two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the page; interlaces, floral and anthropomorphic motifs. - Fol. 30v (incipit page of Ps. 51): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motifs. - Fol. 59r (incipit page of Ps. 101): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, geometric motifs. - Fol. 87v (incipit page of Text I-2): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motifs. Similar to the band on fol. 30v. - Fol. 96v (incipit page of Text I-3): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motifs. - Fol. 102r (incipit page of Text I-4): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral, anthropomorphic and geometric motifs. - Fol. 110ra (incipit page of Text I-5): coloured (strong red and black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motifs.
